ch.chnoch.thesis.renderer.interfaces
Interface Node

All Known Implementing Classes:
Group, Leaf, PhysicsGroup, ShapeNode, TransformGroup
public interface Node

A Node is an element in a GraphSceneManager. The scene manager can contain several nodes. There are two different types, the Group and Leaf. Every group can contain several child nodes. Every leaf should contain some element that can be used in rendering the scene manager.
Not all the methods defined in this interface are necessarily implemented in every class that implement it. Some of the methods only make sense for groups and other for leaves. Some are only needed if a physics engine is active.

setActiveState

void setActiveState(boolean b)
Sets a flag indicating whether this node should be activated for user interaction. If it is not, it can't be selected and manipulated by the user.

Parameters:
b - the active state

getBoundingBox

BoundingBox getBoundingBox()
Gets the bounding box of the node. If the node is a Group, it will create a bounding box that contains all the children.

Returns:
the bounding box

addChild

Adds a child to the node. This is only used in classes extending Group.

Parameters:

removeChild

boolean removeChild(Node child)
Removes a child to the node. This is only used in classes extending Group.

Parameters:
child - the child to be removed
Returns:
returns true if the child could be removed successfully and false if not

intersect

RayShapeIntersection intersect(Ray ray)
Intersect a node with a given ray.

Parameters:
ray - the ray that needs to be intersected
Returns:
the RayShapeIntersection that contains information about if and where a hit between the node and the ray occurred

enablePhysicsProperties

void enablePhysicsProperties(Box2DWorld world)
Enables the physics properties for this node.

Parameters:
world - the object that represents the physics world.

updatePositionFromPhysic

void updatePositionFromPhysic()
Reflects the position change of the node back from the physics world. This is used to keep the position of the physics world and the visual world in synchronization.

getPhysicsProperties

Box2DBody getPhysicsProperties()
Gets the physics properties of this node.

Returns:
the physics representation of this object
